page.title: 14BAPTIST CHURCH
page.content: In{1909,}a{chapel}was{built}in the Southend. It was used every Sunday from 11 o'clock until noon, but only about 12 people attended. There was also an evening service, however, which was attended by many more people.The chapel has no bell and no spire. It was built by{Jimmy Grieve}(from Silverhall) for a man called{John {Irvine,}who owned Stove farm and who wanted to do something for the Baptists. The last people to use it were {Baptists}who came in the summer time two years ago from the neighbouring islands of Westray and Eday; it was also used for a service last autumn held by a{visiting colporteur.}There is little hope of the church staying open much longer.
